title: Drawing, "Competition Design for La Fenice, Venice: Exterior Elevation of Annex", 1788
medium: Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, watercolor, graphite on paper
inscribed: Inscription: FIANCO DELL'EDIFCIO  ANNESSO AL TEATRO.; at lower right, T. ˆ VIII
provenance: Giovanni Piancastelli (1845-1926), Rome; Mr. and Mrs. Edward D. Brandegee
creditline: Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund
description: Elevation drawing of the exterior of theater "annex" showing four portals and three stories, executed in tones of tan-rose and dark gray.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Competition Design for La Fenice, Venice: Exterior Elevation of Annex", 1788.
1788. Pen and black ink, brush and gray wash, watercolor, graphite on paper. Museum purchase through gift of various donors and from Eleanor G. Hewitt Fund. 1938-88-121.
